perturbation.original_text: 7.1 The SENDER undertakes the obligation to pay irrevocably and unconditionally the Service for the Contracted Capacity, twenty (20)  calendar days at the latest, after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the SENDER the invoice for the provision of the Service.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1 The SENDER undertakes the obligation to pay irrevocably and unconditionally the Service for the Contracted Capacity, ten (10) calendar days at the latest, after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the SENDER the invoice for the provision of the Service.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the SENDER must pay within 20 calendar days of receiving the invoice. Shortening the payment period to 10 calendar days could violate generally accepted commercial and payment terms, potentially conflicting with regulations that ensure reasonable payment timelines.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially contradicts general commercial law principles related to reasonable payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: 7.9 The shipment tax shall be invoiced in Colombian pesos upon obtaining the corresponding liquidation from the Ministry of Mines and  Energy and shall be paid to ECOPETROL by the SENDER, within the fifteen (15) calendar days after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the  SENDER the corresponding bills or invoices.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.9 The shipment tax shall be invoiced in Colombian pesos upon obtaining the corresponding liquidation from the Ministry of Mines and  Energy and shall be paid to ECOPETROL by the SENDER, within the five (5) calendar days after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the  SENDER the corresponding bills or invoices.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the payment timeframe for shipment tax invoices to 5 calendar days may violate tax laws or regulations mandating a minimum payment period for tax obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with Colombian tax regulations concerning minimum payment periods for tax invoices.

perturbation.original_text: 8.2 Otherwise, In order to guarantee compliance with all and each of the obligations of the SENDER under the Contract hereof, including but  without being limited to the payment of the Fee, the SENDER is obliged to constitute in favor of ECOPETROL and to deliver within ten (10)  business days after the subscription of the Contract hereof for the amount indicated in the Specific Conditions (hereinafter, the "Bond"):    a) A performance policy for the payment of Services issued by an insurance policy legally established in the country, governed by the  General Clauses of ECOPETROL indicated in Annex 3; or    b) An irrevocable stand-by letter of credit at first requirement, issued by (i) a banking establishment authorized to operate in Colombia  with AAA credit rating for its long-term debt in pesos, o (ii) a foreign financial entity with representation or a confirming and payment  bank in Colombia, with risk credit of long term debt in dollars no less than the rating for the foreign sovereign debt of Colombia issued  pursuant to the International Standby Practices (ISP98) of the International Chamber of Commerce, for which, it may be used the form  contained in Annex 4 of the Contract hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2 Otherwise, In order to guarantee compliance with all and each of the obligations of the SENDER under the Contract hereof, including but  without being limited to the payment of the Fee, the SENDER is obliged to constitute in favor of ECOPETROL and to deliver within two (2) business days after the subscription of the Contract hereof for the amount indicated in the Specific Conditions (hereinafter, the "Bond"):    a) A performance policy for the payment of Services issued by an insurance policy legally established in the country, governed by the  General Clauses of ECOPETROL indicated in Annex 3; or    b) An irrevocable stand-by letter of credit at first requirement, issued by (i) a banking establishment authorized to operate in Colombia  with AAA credit rating for its long-term debt in pesos, o (ii) a foreign financial entity with representation or a confirming and payment  bank in Colombia, with risk credit of long term debt in dollars no less than the rating for the foreign sovereign debt of Colombia issued  pursuant to the International Standby Practices (ISP98) of the International Chamber of Commerce, for which, it may be used the form  contained in Annex 4 of the Contract hereof.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the time to deliver the bond to two (2) business days may violate state regulations related to sufficient time for providing bonds, guarantees, or insurance. The reduced timeframe can potentially disrupt standard business protocols and contractual execution.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with contract law requirements related to sufficient notice and reasonable timeframes for fulfilling contractual obligations.
